definition: dish/lean and hungry look (resulting from vegetarian diet)/emaciated look (from malnutrition)
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor

sentences.english: She has a poor complexion and pock marks on her forehead.
sentences.chinese: 她滿面菜色，額頭上有些麻子。

sentences.english: The restaurant serves a wide variety of dishes.
sentences.chinese: 這家餐廳的菜色非常多樣化。

sentences.english: Go in and see the menu is south by comparing menu.
sentences.chinese: 進去看菜單都是南亞兩廣菜色。

sentences.english: Not sure what they are serving you?
sentences.chinese: 不確定他們給你提供什麼菜色嗎？

sentences.english: The menu outside the door has lots of good dishes.
sentences.chinese: 在門外的菜單上有許多好喫的菜色。

sentences.english: The wine pairs well with red meat based dishes as well poultry. It is also a fine accompaniment to cheeses.
sentences.chinese: 與紅肉及家禽類菜色最爲配合，同時也可與芝士搭配。

sentences.english: The dish is salty and sweet with the carmine color and great aroma.
sentences.chinese: 菜色深紅，散發着濃濃的香味，喫起來甜鹹適中。

sentences.english: Eating at a cafeteria, you have many different dishes to choose from.
sentences.chinese: 在自助餐聽喫飯，有許多不同菜色可供你挑選。

sentences.english: Steak Two great examples of raw cow include beef carpaccio and steak tartare.
sentences.chinese: 壽司是非常常見的食物，其中包含生魚到生肉的菜色。

sentences.english: His complexion was sallow, his face swollen.

definition: dish (food prepared according to a specific recipe)
to smell, look and taste great
non-vegetarian dish (including meat, fish, garlic, onion etc)
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor
signature dish/a restaurant’s most famous dish
appetizer/small side dish/easy job/piece of cake/see also 小菜一碟[xiao3 cai4 yi1 die2]
